page.title: 09CLASS 6 SURVEY OF DAD'S JOBS
page.content: We conducted a survey of{work}done by fathers of the thirty children in class 6.We found that 5 dads were engineers,3 were mill-workers,2 worked for the Gas Board,2 for the Police Force,2 were joiners and 2 were land - scape contractors.The other jobs were window and carpet cleaner,insurance agent,estimator,electrician,porter, machine agent,fireman,builder,garage owner,delivery man,truckdriver,painter and contract manager.No-one was{out of {work}at the time of the survey,but two weeks later,2 men,a driver and a mill worker,were made{redundant.}Most dads worked locally.Apart from 9 whose jobs entailed travelling around,only 3 worked in the city of Bradford 8 miles away and one in Wakefield,15 miles distant. GARY SMITH AND DANIEL VAN HEESWYCK
